main event: On July 30, 1952, several parties in Lavallette, New Jersey, observed an unidentified flying object hovering over their houses and reportedly landing in a nearby field.
interesting points: The object appeared to land in a field but did not go any further., The object was described as slightly larger than an ordinary star and exceptionally bright on a clear, moonless night., Observers noted small up and down movements, but it generally remained stationary for a few minutes., Another report described seeing two orange-yellow lights in the sky that behaved unlike known aircraft., No photographs were taken of the sightings.
witness description: Various parties including civilians and military personnel, some with scientific backgrounds.
